title: Introducing: Maggie Moon
content:
Strolling onto the scene with a slightly ungainly youthful charisma and a twee take on riot grrrl, Maggie Moon may well have just invented bubblegumpunk (bubblegunk?).

Armed with quirky, upbeat choruses (I Will Die) and an almost sleazy ability to write sexually frustrated pop gems (Shine), this three track EP from the Pomona quintet is chockablock with thrills, frills and an adorable sense of friendship. ‘You’re such a crazy loverboy‘ screeches the female lead singer on Boop Dap Beep Dap, coming across like an even more lo-fi Be Your Own Pet or even Metric without the outlandish production values. Check out their debut EP Werewolf Thumb below.
